name: Tryp Nacoes Unidas

reviews.text: A good hotel for a business tryp. Front desk was great, and general services and cleaning was fantastic. Nice lobby, natural light on most of the places, nice breakfast (could be better), and quick elevators (yes, I know, but I don't like to waste my time waiting to get into my room!). Wifi is free and available on each floor, and wired in the room. Bathroom was a little bit small, but complete. Room was quite, clean, and with a comfortable bed. Had also a desk were to work.
reviews.title: Nice stay and service

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference. I would recommend it for business trips. The WiFi works great in the rooms and lobby (and it's free). The rooms are adequate, but, not luxurious (carpet and furnishings are bit on the older side). The only true complaint I have is the walls are thin. I could hear the people in the room next door to me. Luckily, they had children and went to bed early!
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: I stayed there during my business trip to Sao Paulo. Must say it’s a very refined hotel with great and helpful staff. The breakfast was great. The rooms – clean and good equipped.
reviews.title: A very good hotel but stay away from rooms around service areas

reviews.text: The only remark – there was no iron in the room. I had to rent one for a high price.
reviews.title: Tiny rooms, property problematic at peak times

reviews.text: I have stayed here a few times, mostly for the good prices in a very expensive market. It is a good value. The people are very nice, the place is clean, and the breakfast is good. However, it is very dated and lacking in style, luxury, or many of the niceties we come to expect in hotels. The gym is terribly out of date. The food at night is plain and limited. The linens, TV channels, and Internet are not great. So, you have to balance out these things with the good price!
reviews.title: Good value, but...

reviews.text: Horrible smell in the corridors and questionable appeareance of the rooms... Old too much used furniture and way used linens.
reviews.title: Not quite a positive surprise

reviews.text: They gave some eecently renovated rooms but it is quite impossible to ge one of those...
reviews.title: OK for business stay, not the best location

reviews.text: A bit tatty and in need of refurbishment.
reviews.title: Nice, love tye brakfast! No pool :(

reviews.text: I have to say that my whole critic for Tryp Nações Unidas is completely influenced by a fact that I discovered as soon as I entered my room (314): the wifi signal was so free that not my iPad or iPhone and nor my laptop was able to connect. In fact, the Estanplaza hotel signal from across the street was much heavier.
reviews.title: Very poor wifi signal. Unacceptable in a business hotel.

reviews.text: Once I discovered (going down to the lobby) that it was not my problem, I complained but there was apparently no solution for that in that area of the hotel. The wifi is free but you can get a "better connection" paying 30 R$ per day!!, but sadly the signal was the same one. I asked to change rooms (it was around 5 in the afternoon and i had not unpacked) but it was "impossible". During my hours in the lobby that afternoon (I connected my PC with the LAN wire in the room but many of the things I needed to do had to be done from my iPad) I saw people and people doing the check-in (dozens, I am not kidding). It seems that the only effort they had to do to change my room was change two numbers in the computer, but apparently it was too much for them...
reviews.title: New hotel, small rooms, nice breakfast

reviews.text: I do not understand these hotels that claim "free wifi!" in their offer, just to discover, on arrival, that it means "lousy wifi" and that, if you want something decent, you have to pay for it (more or less what you pay for half a month at home). The Tryp Nações Unidas goes one step further: in some of the rooms, you can't have it even by paying...
reviews.title: Bad Experience

reviews.text: And for the rest of of the hotel: the rooms are fine but somewhat small. Bathroom and toiletries were ok. TV had a good selection of channels but many of them were not working. It took an hour and talking to 4 people! to get that fixed. Breakfast is the typical in a Brazilian 3 stars hotel, with fruit, eggs, etc. The quality was average. Sadly, the pão de queijo (cheese bread, a Brazilian delicacy) was, and I quote a Brazilian guy who sat in the same table, "the worst ever". I tried it and didn't finish it. Nor did him. I ordered room service one night (around 8 PM and after finishing I left the tray at the door. It was there next day at 9 AM...
reviews.title: Just average, good enough for business

reviews.text: The personnel is kind but their ability to help varies.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.text: - The room is nice, small but well clean.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: - The TV was a bit small than usual.
reviews.title: No frills, just alright..value for money

aka: Tryp Nacoes Unidas Hotel Sao Paulo
